Bayard Tarpley said he was handed a deflection script and told to do everything in his power to shunt claimants of the six-in-one benefit onto a website. The claim - flatly denied by the Department for Work and Pensions- is the latest to hit the benefit, whose rollout is blamed for rising debt and food banks. It comes after an audit report blasted DWP managers for presiding over a department in denial. He told Sky News: We were encouraged to end the call sooner so that we could quickly get through things. There didnt seem to be a lot of changes that were specically there to support claimants.  So there was there is something called the deflection script. It was a piece of paper that explains what to do when someone calls in. Evena problem could be solved then and there on the phone we were encouraged to do everything in our power to get them to hang up the phone and do that online. A DWP spokeswoman said: These claims are completely . We take the training of our call handling staff extremely seriously to ensure they are prepared to handle a range of enquiries, regardless of how long they might take – there is no policy to get callers off the phones.” However, the DWP said it does inform customers they can go online and call agents use aids to process claims effectively. The Mirror are demanding a halt to the expansion of Universal Credit and for a review to take place. We say there are three options:Redesign UC to be fit for purpose Axe it in favour of the old systemUC is unfixable Introduce a brand new systemSign our petition to stop the rollout of Universal Credit across Britain and to replace it with a fairer system by signing our petition. Mr Tarpley told the Mirror: Deflection script is what it was called by managers. It’s what it was called during training and it’s what your team leader would tell you to improve on during -- meetings. I suspect they’re splitting hairs and saying there’s no official document referred to as the deflection script.

title: tory mps including universal credit
story: NewsTory MPs including Universal Credit architect Iain Duncan Smith could lose their seats amid backlash over rolloutAmong those are high profile former ministers including Amber Rudd and Iain Duncan Smith - the architect of the governments flagship welfare schemeShareCommentsByNicola BartlettPolitical Correspondent:,  OCT NewsIain Duncan Smith has himself said UC needs another £billion to make it work "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailAround  Tory MPs could lose their seats amid the backlash over Universal Credit, a study has warned. Among those are high profile former ministers including Amber Rudd and Iain Duncan Smith - the architect of the governments flagship welfare scheme. Ministers including Secretary of State for Wales Alun Cairns, Environment Minister George Eustice and Work and Pensions Minister Alok Sharma could also be rejected at the polls. Analysis by campaign group  degrees shows these constituencies have more people who could be moved onto Universal Credit - potentially losing them money - than the MPs majority. If just a fth of those affected are Conservative voters who switch their vote, the Conservative party could lose so many seats at any election they struggle to work even a minority government.  It comes as a public spending watchdog found Universal Credit is causing “unacceptable hardship” for many of its claimants. The Public Accounts Committee said the Tory “fortress mentality” is failing claimants who are struggling to adapt. Universal Credit, which is being rolled out gradually, replaces six existing benefits with a single payment - but critics have argued the programme, which has been subject to several delays, is flawed. A report by the Child Poverty Action Group suggests single parents face a cut in their income of pound, a year, families with two children could lose pound, on average and families with three children face a cut of pound,.Despite being the architect of UC, Iain Duncan-Smith has himself quit the Cabinet over welfare cuts and has demanded another poundbillion be pumped into Universal Credit to make it work. While former Tory PM Sir John Major has warned it could become Theresa Mays poll tax which sparked riots and helped lead to her downfall.  The research comes after more than , people signed a  Degrees petition to Chancellor Philip Hammond, calling on him to put more money into the Universal Credit system. Charlotte Woodworth, Campaigns Director at  Degrees, said: Tens of thousands of people have called on the Chancellor to ease the pain of Universal Credit.And hundreds of  Degrees members affected by Universal Credit have emailed their MPs to share their fears. While the concern about its effects is widespread, this analysis shows the government also face a political cost.The Mirror are demanding a halt to the expansion of Universal Credit and for a review to take place. We say there are three options:Redesign UC to be fit for purpose Axe it in favour of the old systemUC is unfixable Introduce a brand new systemSign our petition to stop the rollout of Universal Credit across Britain and to replace it with a fairer system by signing our petition. Our analysis found that in  Conservative-held constituencies, the number of people who could see their income reduced is five times greater than the majority of the current MP. Our calculations found thatjust a fth of those affected are Conservative voters who switch their vote, Theresa May’s government could be in deep trouble.  degrees members are calling on the Chancellor to use his Budget to give more money to universal credit and so ease the pain families up and down the country are facing.”  Degrees has compared the number of households that are expected to be affected with the parliamentary majorities of the sitting MPs.In  constituencies, there are five times as many households affected as the parliamentary majority of the incumbent MPin the  general election.

title: easyjet leaves blind man stranded
story: NewsEasyJet leaves blind man stranded abroad after he refused to attach unsafe harness to guide dogDavid Ferguson was due to fly back from Portugal when a flight attendant demanded he attach a seat-belt extender to his beloved guide dog JamieShareCommentsByNeil Murphy:,  OCT NewsDavid Ferguson says his guide dog Jamie has changed his le six years ago"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA blind man says easyJet left him stranded after he was kicked off a plane when he refused to attach an unsafe harness to his guide dog. David Ferguson, from Bangor in Northern Ireland, was flying back to Belfast with his dog Jamie following a trip to southern Portugal. The pair were scheduled to take the .pm easyJet flight from Faro to Belfast City Airport on theirjourney home when they encountered problems. After boarding the aircraft, David says a flight attendant demanded he attach a seatbelt extender to his dog Jamie - something which David deemed unsafe as it was made for humans and not for dogs. The retired -year-old refused to use the extender because he feared for Jamies safety in the event of a crash.  David and Jamie have previously boarded flights to Gatwick and Spain without issue using a cushioned harness he provides for plane journeys. The safety harness is approved for use on airplanes by the Civil Aviation Authority, David says. David suffers from Usher syndrome, a disorder that causes loss of both hearing and vision, and says he struggled to understand the companys staff.The flight was held up for  minutes while he negotiated with crew - but was eventually booted off the plane. At one stage, a pilot for the airline intervened in the dispute but found nothing wrong with seat belt extender. I was humiliated in front of the people on that aircraft, he said. Ive been with my dog  hours a day since I got him six years ago and as blind people were told to always know where our dogs are at all times.  Theres no way I would put him in danger or allow anyone to put him in danger. The airline effectively left a blind person stranded in the airport with almost no way of getting home. David originally booked his holiday with Thomas Cook and says he was surprised when he discovered that he would be flying with easyJet. After being kicked off the plane, David was left with no alternative but to fork out €for a Ryanair flight back to Dublin. Once there, had to endure a two-hour bus trip to Belfast from the Irish capital. David arrived home at .am thanks to help from his good friend Kenny Tosh who drove him back from the airport. He says his quality of le has improved dramatically since he was given the eight-year-old Labrador back in . He has literally changed my le, David said.  Before I had Jamie I was afraid to leave the house on my own unless someone picked me up. At one stage I walked into a lamppost and I was nearly knocked over. David has demanded airline staff be better informed about the challenges faced by blind people when travelling on their aircraft. If this is how they treat blind people Id be amazed to see how they treat able-bodied persons, he said. An easyJet statement toread: Unfortunately Mr Ferguson and his guide dog were not permitted to travel from Faro to Belfast on September  as he failed to comply with on-board safety regulations surrounding the securing of his dog for take off and landing. “Our policy makes it clear that dogs must wear a standard identying jacket or harness which is provided by the owner, which must be attached to the owners seat belt via the use of an extension seat belt in order to provide an effective level of restraint. “The safety and wellbeing of passengers and crew is always easyJets highest priority.”

title: incredible bravery story sas legend
story: NewsPrince Harrys touching tribute to incredible act of SAS bravery during elite units finest hourEXCLUSIVE: SAS Sergeant Talaiasi Labalaba fought during the Battle of Mirbat in Oman, widely considered the finest hour of the SASShareCommentsByJulie McCaffrey:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsPrince Harry and Fijis President Jioji Konrote pose in front of a new statue commemorating Sergeant Talaiasi Labalaba, a British-Fijian soldier who lost his le in the  Battle of Mirbat "Get Royal Family updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailProud is a word Roger Cole doesn’t use often. He is a rare and shyexceptional hero who insists he is nothing of the sort, recalling his SAS career and death-defying deeds asthey were ordinary days in the office. But as Prince Harry unveiled a statue to SAS Sergeant Talaiasi Labalaba in Fiji, Roger felt a rush of pride. He and “Laba” fought together during the Battle of Mirbat in Oman, widely considered the finest hour of the SAS. Roger saw Laba, , single-handedly man a lb field gun, usually crewed by four, to protect the nine-strong band of brothers, as well as locals, from the attack of  enemy soldiers – even after bullets blew away half his jaw. Sadly Roger, now , last saw his Fijian friend zipped into a body bag. And seeing the statue brought all those memories back.  Roger says: “I felt proud to have known Laba and to see him so respected. Really proud. Quite overwhelmed, actually. “This man who was always smiling, always positive even in the worst sshyituations. And he was very steely – he easily coped with everything. He deserves more recognition than he got. “Hopefully, having the world’s cameras on Laba’s statue means more people will appreciate what he did. Because within my memories of him smiling and sadness at losing him, it’s always irked me that he didn’t get the Victoria Cross.”  In  the SAS was secretly stationed in Oman to bolster Britain’s ally the Sultan and protect Arabian oil fields from communist guerrillas, trained by Russia and China, called the Adoo. As part of Operation Jaguar, their first mission was to win the hearts and minds of locals in Mirbat, a small coastal town. Roger, then a -year-old lance corporal, says: “None of the locals knew anything about the outside world so they were very taken aback to see us. “We were medics who helped give their babies medicine and set up football teams for the kids. Laba had a really special way with children.”  At .am on July , the day the men were due to fly home, Roger was sleeping at the house they were based in when he was woken up by a fellow shysoldier. Roger recalls: “He said, ‘I think we’re being attacked’. And I said, ‘bugger off’. Then I heard ‘boom boom boom’, looked out and saw bombs landing all over the place.” Roger got dressed and manned a machine gun as the enemy advanced to a nearby fort on the town’s outskirts. He says: “We’d immaculately trained for this. Laba ran  yards under fierce fire towards the gun pit outside the fort.” Thick mist cut visibility to  yards and when Roger saw  figures through the gloom, he “knocked them down”. But waves of enemies, armed with Kalashnikovs, rocket-propelled grenades and mortars, kept advancing.  Roger says: “With swirling mist, and enemy constantly coming up from trenches, I felt asI was in a World War One film. Around  minute s later the radio crackled with a message from Laba, ‘I’ve been hit. I’m still OK’. He was horrendously injured, yet carried on firing, knowingthe Adoo got hold of that gun we were all f***ed.” The gun, normally fired at long-range, was being used like a rle as the enemy were so close to the barbed wire perimeter of the gun pit. Sgt Sekonaia “Tak” Takavesi, a fellow Fijian, ran to Laba’s aid in another feat of bravery which the SAS also believes is deserving of a Victoria Cross. Roger says: “One hundred and fty guys were shooting at him from  yards, bullets and grenades were bouncing off the ground. “Tak ran like a rugby player, ducking, dodging and weaving to get to his line. And he made it. I still can barely believe what I saw.” Tak found Laba wounded to his chin. And while Tak was himself shot in the back and shoulder, he leaned against sandbags and kept firing. At .am the -pounder gun fell silent.  Commanding officer Captain Mike Kealy, aged only , decided to run to the gun pit and trooper Tommy Tobin volunteered to go with him. Mike ordered a mortar to be fired close to the gun pit. “It could have gone seriously wrong and wiped out our own men,” says Roger. “But it worked - it frightened the enemy back.” Mike and Tommy reached the pit and found Laba had been shot in the throat. A message came across the radio to Roger: “Laba is dead.” Tommy’s jaw was also blown off and he died later back in Britain. “It didn’t sink in at first,” admits Roger. “Adrenaline is so high, focus fully on the task ahead, there’s no time for emotion.“ Yet even at the height of battle, Roger spent time treating local casualties. A helicopter arrived to help, but came under fire and had to turn back. Then as the fighting raged, a radio message told Roger two jets were on their way. “They asked, ‘How many enemy ’ I replied, ‘A f*****g lot’.” The planes fired rockets and machine guns, and dropped lb bombs. One was damaged and left the battle. The other ran out of ammunition. Roger says: “When I got back on the roof with Corporal Bob Bennett, we saw a large troop marching towards us. We looked at each other and said, ‘Bloody hell’. It was our Zulu moment. “I knew this could be our last half hour. I had  rounds left. Bob had ten. “And that’s when pictures of my we Pauline and daughter Natasha, only nine months old, came into my mind. I would never let the enemy take me alive – I would’ve shot myself with my last bullet.” The sound of helicopters eventually broke through the gunfire. A -men back-up SAS team arrived and the Adoo started to flee. Roger says: “Years later, when I was writing my book, I spoke to someone on the other side. He told us we fought off  men that day.” The choppers were loaded with dead bodies and casualties. Roger continues: “I saw Tak walking to the helicopter to make sure Tommy got inside, even though he had four bullet holes in him.” The battle was won. Yet silence surrounded their victory. Roger adds: “I wanted to say, ‘We have just won a war’. Yet no one knows a thing about it. All of the Mirbat survivors are still good friends – almost family. “We have a bond that can’t be broken, and that gave us strength. The only thing we want is to see Laba properly shyrecognised. Prince William unveiled a statue in the SAS camp at Hereford, but the public can’t see that. “Prince Harry immediately said he’d unveil Laba’s new statue in Fiji. “He knows Laba is an SAS legend. Maybe now we can get our government to realise the same thing and give him the posthumous Victoria Cross.”SAS Operation Storm: Nine Men Against Four Hundred by Roger Cole and Richard Belfield, published in paperback by Hodder  Stoughton pound..

Mum-to-be Meghan opted for a power suit combo with a smart red blazer by Australian brand Scanlan Theodore and tapered black trousers, paired with black heels. The royals arrived to cheering crowds as they took their seats. After the game, Harry and Meghan stepped onto the court to meet the players - with one giving Meghan a peck on the cheek.Later the royal couple will attend the closing ceremony of the games - which champion the healing power of sport in the support of wounded and sick veterans and current servicemen and women.  The couple had the morning to themselves before heading to the auditorium where they sat behind a row of veterans. Harry and Meghan are on the th day of their jam-packed -day Royal Tour, which has so far taken them to Australia, Fiji and Tonga. Tomorrow they will fly to New Zealand for a final four days. Meghan and Harrys pal Beckham and his son Romeo attended the wheelchair basketball during their family holiday in Sydney. Speaking about the Games, ambassador Beckham said: I know how sport can change peoples lives, I know how sport has a real power to improve peoples lives in many dferent ways. Its been such an emotional week for everyone involved.  competitors, over  family members is such a special thing. Later, the royals will attend the closing ceremony of the games.  Prince Harrys Invictus Games opening ceremony was delayed after a torrential rain storm hit Sydney. Thunder and lightning battered the harbour where a stage has been set up outside the Sydney Opera House to officially launch the  games Down Under. Organisers put an emergency plan in place, closing the site and forcing hundreds of spectators to run for cover. Videos and images from Sydney show lightening strikes and thunderous clouds above the city as the ceremony was about to start. Technical equipment was damaged following the electrical storm which has delayed the opening ceremony of the Invictus Games, organisers said. Prince Harry speaks about personal joy at Meghans pregnancy at Invictus Games opening ceremonyDuring the opening ceremony, Harry honoured the one Invictus generation - service personnel, veterans and war dead. The duke thanked the hosts for the welcome and said he and Meghan are so happy to celebrate the personal joy of our newest addition with you all. title: michael sheen its superheroes who
story: NewsopinionMichael Sheen: It’s the superheroes who save us when the safety net failsCouncil budgets slashed, public services decimated, foodbanks, mental health issues, domestic violence, the effects of Universal CreditShareCommentsByMichael Sheen:,  OCT NewsopinionActor Michael Sheen meets with Sue, who he describes as a real-le superhero "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailSue is on the frontline. shyEveryone knows Sue. At  years of age and not five feet tall, she’s the closest thing you’ll find to a real-le superhero. She works for a charity called TRAC out of a small shop in Trevethin, Gwent. Trevethin has it harder than most, but it’s not unlike far too many other communities across the country that would recognise what’s happening there. Council budgets slashed, public services decimated, foodbanks, mental health issues, domestic violence, the effects of Universal Credit. “I don’t want to swear”, says Sue, “but, you know, we’re saving lives here because others have given up on the people that get referred to us.”  With a small team of staff and committed volunteers, Sue makes sure the basics are there for people who need them – furniture, clothing, food, fuel, white goods. Some of them are reclaimed from landfill, others are donations from all over the area. Care agencies refer people who need help to TRAC, and within hours provisions are on their way. Sue delivers them herself, her head just visible above her van’s steering wheel. “We’re trying to prevent them from going to doorstep lenders and shycompanies like BrightHouse,” she says. “I’m paying out on the van now and it’s not going to last much longer.” With so many services in the area being cut back – mental health services, hostels, council support and welfare – the need for Sue’s help is only increasing.

title: philip green tracked down bolthole
story: NewsPhilip Green is tracked down to US bolthole as he hides out from scandalWhen confronted by the Mirror, he said: “You’ve come a long way. Thank you but I can’t say anything”ShareByChristopher BucktinNick SommerladNicola Bartlett:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsMirror man Christopher Bucktin confronts Green "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe Daily Mirror tracked down shamed tycoon Sir Philip Green to his US bolthole yesterday. The Topshop boss was playing tennis in the sweltering heat of Tucson, Arizona, one day after he was revealed to have spent pound, in legal fees trying to silence sexual and racial harassment claims. When confronted by the Mirror, he said: “You’ve come a long way. Thank you but I can’t say anything” Green, facing calls to be stripped of his knighthood, flew to the state in his poundmillion Gulfsteam jet. He owns a pound.million home there. He played tennis for  minutes, but only got one set in between phone calls as the #MeToo scandal swirled around him. The Mirror confronted the shamed tycoon amid the fallout of him being outed in Parliament trying to gag a newspaper. When askedhis accusers were making their claims up, he replied: “I can’t say anything for legal reasons.” He then sped off in his luxury golf cart.  Green, , is facing calls to drop his injunction preventing reporting of a string of gagging orders signed by former staff, who allege he bullied and sexually and racially harassed them. Three months after he launched a pound, legal bid to silence the , Green insisted: “I categorically and wholly deny these allegations”. Sweltering in C heat, Green wiped sweat from his brow as he lunged for the ball against a man in his s. The billionaire, a keen tennis player, owns a pound.million bolt hole a stone’s throw from the courts, which are in the grounds of the Canyon Ranch Wellness Resort. It is thought he also flew there in the wake of the BHS scandal in . A source said: “Whenever troubled has flared, he has been known to head to Tucson, leaving behind his place in Monaco or his yachts.”  Meanwhile, the Mirror unearthed a picture of the Topshop boss with his arm around the waist of a young woman in little more than lingerie and angel wings. The Las Vegas photo reveals the tycoon in a frilly shirt fancy dress outfit unbuttoned to the waist, before his name was dragged into a string of scandals. It was allegedly taken in the Bellagio Hotel on Halloween in . An onlooker told the Mirror: “It was early evening when I saw Sir Philip leaving the Bellagio with two young women. “It was Halloween and everyone dresses up in America, so it seemed normal. He was clearly off to a shy and got into a car. “There was no sign of Lady Green. He was holding this woman close and clearly enjoying himself.” Before we tracked him down, the Mirror spotted the tycoon’s poundmillion jet parked discreetly at Tucson International Airport in Arizona. Green was seen talking on his mobile as he strolled in the US state.  A source said: “It’s no secret, Phil’s love of Arizona. He gushes about the place. It allows him to escape the stresses of his business. The Gulfstream GER had left Las Vegas on Sunday destined for the Arizona city, but as it was making its approach it erted to Los Angeles. Little more than  hours later, at .am on Monday, it left LAX to make the -minute journey to Tucson. The aircraft is described as the “holy grail of private jets”, flying non-stop from Hong Kong to New York. Green, often snapped with A-listers including supermodels, actors and music stars, has a transport collection that also includes a speedboat, a helicopter and other yachts. It is thought he came to Canyon Ranch amid the BHS scandal. In  he sold the chain to investors with no retail experience. A year later it fell apart with , job losses and a poundmillion pension black hole. Yesterday the #MeToo scandal continued to swirl around Green, with a hashtag of pinknotgreen swept social media. It called for a boycott of Green’s shops, including Dorothy Perkins, Wallis and Burton. On Thursday, former Labour minister Peter Hain told the House of Lords it was his “duty” to name Green due to the “serious and repeated” nature of allegations.  He told Parliament he had “been contacted by someone intimately involved in the case of a powerful businessman using non-disclosure agreements and substantial payments to conceal the truth about serious and repeated sexual harassment, racist abuse and bullying.” A barrister claimed Lord Hain’s conduct was “completely improper”. The peer said it was “the right thing to do”. Parliamentary privilege protects MPs or peers from being prosecuted over statements made in the Commons or Lords. Green said after Lord Hain named him: “I am not commenting on anything that has happened in court or was said in Parliament today. “To the extent that it is suggested I have been guilty of unlawful sexual or racist behaviour, I categorically and wholly deny these allegations. “These settlements are confidential so I cannot comment further.” Thespent eight months investigating accusations against the tycoon. But on Tuesday it was prevented from revealing the existence of non-disclosure deals by a interim injunction issued by the Court of Appeal. Women and Equalities Select Committee chair Maria Miller, who has called for reform of such deals, suggested it was time to “consider whether NDAs are actually outlawed”. She added: “Unfortunately they’ve become so misused that some feel they can do anything as long as they can afford to pay for the victims’ silence, and that is no way for our legal system to work.”

title: salisbury cathedral part new axis
story: NewsopinionIs Salisbury Cathedral part of a new Axis of Evil That spire seems to have an awful lot to answer forShareCommentsByFleet Street FoxColumnist:,  OCT Newsopinion"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailIran did a deal. Iraq got bombed back to the Stone Age. North Korea was invited to tea. Into the void where the Axis of Evil once terried the world, a new existential threat to civilisation has been born. And it has a spire  metres tall. Unbeknown to the , tourists who visit it each year, it seems that Salisbury Cathedral is built on an inter-dimensional whirlpool which sucks evil down towards hell like sand in an hour-glass. The presence of these unwitting pilgrims, walking widdershins around the cloisters, merely speeds up the spiritual centruge.Hence the bemusement of Russian spies who, on an entirely-heterosexual visit under  names to the East End of London, found themselves dragged towards the bewitching building. They broke free of its unearthly tractor beam only when they dropped a bottle of perfume that Ruslan had bought as a gt for his mother, and was unfortunately past its sell-by date.Caught in the Salisbury swirl, the liquid mutated into a battlefield nerve agent with unforeseen deadly consequences when it was dropped on the doorstep of a building that happened to be home to a Russian defector. They didnt get to see the spire. Which is a shame, because theyd heard it was the tallest in Britain.  The vortex is felt across the world. It drew a team of  assassins from Riyadh to Istanbul, where CCTV was disabled when an unfortunate journalist tripped and fell over a discarded bone saw, several times, and then cut off his own face and thew it down a well. It also compelled his accidental murderers to flee before the Turkish authorities could persuade them to headbutt a bullet, develop a sexual attraction to mincers, or perhaps most suicidally of all, announce they were taking up careers as journalists.The evil eddy even forced an otherwise-gentle and liberal soul entirely in tune with st century social norms to scream UGLY BLACK B******! at a Windrush migrant.The more cynical corners of the internet have whispered that Ryanair flights are the twisted children of Salisburys malevolent maelstrom, producing miniaturised tides of despair and misery, but the companys official ouija board insists in the face of all the evidence that it is just a coincidence.  Now it appears Salisburys undertow to the underworld has drawn someone all the way into the cathedral itself, there to smash two holes in the specially-toughened glass box in which lies one of only  remaining original copies of the Magna Carta.At time of writing no-one has been charged in relation to the Get Carta incident, but there are three madcap theories of who could be responsible:. A grammarist insistent on adding the definite article to the documents customary description, becausethe is written on the bloody thing people cant not use it . The ruler of a nation in political crisis who wants to add a th clause stating Brexit means Brexit on the basisthey didnt know what it meant in the th century she cannot be blamed for making it up as she goes along in the st . Nicholas Cage on one of his many flights of fancy, trying to crack a hidden medieval code that links the Founding Fathers to Jesus secret lovechild, whose ultimate descendant turns out to be Indiana Jones dad.  Of course, thats all ridiculous, isnt it  As mad as finding someone in Old Sarum wants planning permission for an underground shark tank, or that Kim Jong Un has moved his embassy to Middle Wallop. Or genuinely thinking that because both Porton Down and a village called Palestine are in the vicinity, Salisbury must be on speed-dial to the Devil himself. There are no forces of evil. Salisbury is no more be a wormhole to the netherworld than it is a coral atoll in the South Pacic. Whoever tried to steal the Magna Carta was too dumb to realise it was alarmed, it would disentegrate within  minutes and would be harder to sell on than Philip Greens used undercrackers. Evil is a supernatural force which means some people are born beyond redemption - destined for corruption and amorality, and liablecaught to be crucied, electried, poisoned or shot because theyre something other than human. But evil is just an excuse.Humans are merely bad. They make bad decisions and do bad things, making bad excuses along the way. Vladimir Putin ordered the elaborately-dficult murder of Sergei Skripal because he thought the defector was evil, and evil deserves the effort. The Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia ordered the elaborately-messy murder of Jamal Kashoggi for the same reason. And people like the Ryanair racist arent evil, either. Theyre angry, ignorant, unsocialised outcasts, often sick and usually screaming at the world for not being nicer to them. When we say something is evil we refuse to take responsibility. We say it was out of our hands when the Twin Towers fell or the policeman was kned or the terrorists got through. We dont say: How did we make that terrorist  Why dont we spend money on people who do bad stuff  What has to change before we accept that guy other there goes to the toilet just like I do Whoever tried to steal the Magna Carta, whoever is sending bombs to Donald Trumps enemies, whoever strokes Tommy Robinsons cancerous ego is not evil. Theyre us, with a few things gone wrong. A lost job, a last straw, a loose wire.If we stop saying its evil -we stop saying maybe thats just Salisbury for you - we might be able to fix it. You dont solve problems with an excuse.

One of the cars got stuck half way round, Greg, from Liverpool, told .He said the car stopped on a flat level at least the height of two guys on top of each others shoulders, about  or ft high.They manually winched the ride to get it to a  for the riders to get down. title: sir philip green snapped las
story: NewsPhilip Green snap alongside scantily clad Vegas showgirl emerges as billionaire hides in Arizona boltholeEXCLUSIVE: The picture, obtained by the Mirror and taken in Las Vegas, reveals the billionaire in his pomp before his name was dragged into a string of scandalsShareByNick SommerladChristopher BucktinNicola Bartlett:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsPhilip Green with his arm round a woman at a casino in Las Vegas"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailWith his trademark grin, Sir Philip Green wraps his arm around the waist of a young woman in little more than lingerie and angel wings. The picture, obtained by the Mirror and taken in Las Vegas, reveals the billionaire in his pomp before his name was dragged into a string of scandals. As we today tracked down Green to Arizona, there were demands for the tycoon to be stripped of his knighthood. He is facing calls to drop his injunction preventing reporting of a string of gagging orders signed by former staff, who allege he bullied and sexually and racially harassed them. Three months after he launched a pound, legal bid to silence the , Green issued a statement this week in which he insisted: “I categorically and wholly deny these allegations”.  The Las Vegas photograph shows Green wearing one of his much-loved fancy dress outfits, a frilly shirt unbuttoned to the waist, with the unidentied young woman at his side. It was allegedly taken in the Bellagio Hotel on Halloween in . An onlooker told the Mirror: “It was early evening when I saw Sir Philip leaving the Bellagio with two young women. “It was Halloween and everyone dresses up in America, so it seemed normal. He was clearly off to aand got into a car. “There was no sign of Lady Green. He was holding this woman close and clearly enjoying himself.”  Tonight Green appeared to be lying low after being named in Parliament as the businessman behind the injunction. The Mirror spotted the Topshop tycoon’s poundmillion private jet parked discreetly at Tucson International Airport in Arizona. Green was seen talking on his mobile as he strolled in the US state.A source said: “It’s no secret Phil’s love of Arizona. He gushes about the place.  “It has year-round sun and allows him to escape the stresses of his business. “Whenever troubled has flared before he has been known to head to Tucson, leaving behind his place in Monaco or his yachts.Normally where ever his Gulfstream is, Phil is not far away.” The Gulfstream GER had left Las Vegas on Sunday destined for the Arizona city, but as it was making its approach it erted to Los Angeles.  Little more than  hours later, at .am on Monday, it left LAX to make the -minute journey to Tucson. Green’s aircraft is described as the “holy grail of private jets”. It can fly non-stop from Hong Kong to New York. It was delivered in , weeks before the Green family’s Lionheart superyacht arrived.The vessel is understood to have cost poundmillion. Green, often snapped with A-listers such as the late Dirty Dancing actor Patrick Swayze, has a transport collection that also includes a speedboat, a helicopter and other yachts.  He is a regular in Tucson, where he visits the Canyon Ranch wellness resort at the foot of Santa Catalina Mountains. It thought he used the retreat during the BHS scandal. In  he sold the chain to investors with no retail experience. A year later it went to the wall with , job losses and a poundmillion pension fund black hole. Meanwhile the #MeToo scandal continued to swirl around Green today. A hashtag of pinknotgreen swept across social media, with calls for a boycott of Green’s shops, including Dorothy Perkins, Wallis and Burton.On Thursday, ex-Labour minister Peter Hain told the House of Lords he felt it was his “duty” to name Green due to the “serious and repeated” nature of allegations. He told Parliament he had “been contacted by someone intimately involved in the case of a powerful businessman using non-disclosure agreements and substantial payments to conceal the truth about serious and repeated sexual harassment, racist abuse and bullying”. A barrister claimed Lord Hain’s conduct was “completely improper”, but the peer said it was “the right thing to do”. He later told BBC Newsnight: “I considered it extremely seriously before I said it. I’m discharging myas a parliamentarian, and what concerned me about this case was wealth, and power that comes with it, and abuse.”  Parliamentary privilege protects MPs or peers from being prosecuted over statements made in the Commons or Lords. Green said after Lord Hain named him: “I am not commenting on anything that has happened in court or was said in Parliament today. “To the extent that it is suggested that I have been guilty of unlawful sexual or racist behaviour, I categorically and wholly deny these allegations. “These settlements are confidential so I cannot comment further on them.” Thespent eight months investigating accusations against the tycoon. But on Tuesday the newspaper was prevented from revealing the existence of non-disclosure deals by a interim injunction issued by the Court of Appeal. Women and Equalities Select Committee chair Maria Miller, who has called for reform of such deals, today suggested it was time to “consider whether NDAs are actually outlawed”. She added: “Unfortunately they’ve become so misused that some feel they can do anything as long as they can afford to pay for the victims’ silence, and that is no way for our legal system to work.”

title: student seen struggling stand hours
story: NewsStudent seen struggling to stand hours before death at boozy university initiation where he downed  vodkasEdward Farmer, , had been taking part in an Agricultural Society initiation event in December , where he may have had up to  shots of vodka in less than three hoursShareCommentsByAbigail OLearyHannah Graham:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video cctv-captures-ed-farmers-final-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA student was captured on CCTV struggling to stand hours before he died at a boozy university initiation ceremony. Edward Farmer, from Leicestershire, had been taking part in an Agricultural Society initiation event in December , where he had up to  shots of vodka in less than three hours. The -year-old, a Newcastle University Fresher, died due to the toxic effects of an excessive amount of alcohol in a short period of time, according to an inquest. Edwards death sent shockwaves through the university, which has now banned initiation ceremonies, reports ChronicleLive . The ceremonies are often carried out when freshers join a new society and usually involve drinking large quantities of alcohol. At Newcastle University, most students ChronicleLive approached had heard about the Mr Farmers death, and have seen stories about the inquest over recent days. All agree that it is shocking - one calls the story terrying.  One man said his flatmate is a member of the Agricultural Society, the group which organised the initiation which ended in Mr Farmers death. Theyve all been warned about it, he said. Music student Holly Clarke said it had been a shock to hear about the tragedy, which didnt line up with her experience at university at all. I honestly thought it was an American thing that happened in frat houses there, or maybe at Oxbridge - it doesnt seem like something that would have happened here, she said. I havent experienced anything like it. Its terrying that something like that could happen. Drink and death with students, it feels completely unheard of, and the fact that it was through an initiation process worries me. I think part of it is that with new students theres this idea that youve got to go out and get drunk, thats part of the culture, and thats not just Newcastle. People are being inserted into a new environment, they want to fit in and make friends and the way they do that is by drinking - freshers are socially expected to drink a lot. Newcastle University officially bans initiations to its student societies. The university website warns anyone found to have organised or participated in an initiation ritual will be subject to disciplinary action, saying the events encourage excessive drinking, force humiliating and degrading behavior, and may bring the institution into disrepute.  Speaking at the inquest, however, Lesley Braiden, academic registrar at Newcastle University, said it was dficult,not impossible, to monitor initiation events. The group of lads who met with the Chronicle, who admit to having some experience of initiations, therefore ask to remain anonymous. Now studying for masters degrees, most of them completed their undergraduate at Newcastle, when several of them participated in the events as freshers. However, they said they dont recognise some of the more shocking challenges mentioned in Mr Farmers inquest - apple bobbing in urine or drinking from a pigs head - and they dont think the initiations are a more general problem for the university. One man said: A lot of sport societies have initiations, a lot of first years get excessively drunk and do silly challenges. What happened is awful - when someone gets to that stage thats when you stop and make sure theyre alright. But the way its being portrayed makes it sound like its a problem with our student culture in general. Its being made into a bit of a witch-hunt against Newcastle and societies. You cant say its completely safe, but when students take part, theyre  and they choose to do it. You might be egged on but youre not forced to drink. The group listed the activities theyd think of as being involved in initiations, saying it is mostly drinking games, and some times tasting unpleasant non-alcoholic things. Youd pour spirits into a football boot and drink them, or do shots of something thats a bit disgusting, one said. When asked about the university ban on initiations, the students were only vaguely aware of it.  A third man said: You get emails, but I dont think anybody is really going to listen to it - theyd just call them something . While these students admitted to having experienced initiations, and one witness at Mr Farmers inquest said they were widespread, most of those wandering around campus who agreed to speak said it was not something theyd come across. Fourth year chemical engineering student Jono Morley said: I havent experienced anything like that. I think its just sports teams, although Ive got friends on sports teams whove never done anything like that. He agreed there was a culture of heavy drinking more generally, but not more so than in other universities or cities. I would say most students here are the same as at any other university: its just students being students. For third year psychology student Charlotte White, this drinking culture felt alienating as a fresher - so she started up the Newcastle University Sober Socials society. Teetotal Charlotte was keen to take part in activities which didnt centre around drinking, but found most of the activities organised by university clubs seemed to involve going out. She founded the society, now in its second year, for drinkers and non-drinkers alike who wanted a club whose social activities didnt focus on boozing. The really friendly group go out for coffee, bowling, or host sober film nights. I tried to find societies I could feel comfortable in but a lot of them would only offer club nights, she said. In Freshers Week they do put on some non-drinking events but after that its just sort of expected thatyou want to socialise you go out drinking.  People are expected even before they go to uni to drink a lot as freshers - family members would say to me oh, Newcastle, theres great night le there so theres a sense you have to take advantage of that. There can be a pressure to drink: a lot of friends have come to me and said I wish I could say no but they feel likethey want to go and make friends they have to pretend they are really up for it. The -year-old, who is also studying drinking culture in universities as part of her academic work, says that pressure can also extend to the amount drunk: theres a sense that students should not just drink, but get drunk. People say oh, Ill come out for one but friends say have another, Ill buy you one, evenyoure trying to control it and be sensible it doesnt happen. Theyre trying to make sure everyone has fun, but that means drinking. Newcastle University registrar, Dr John Hogan, said: Ed’s death was a great tragedy which shocked us all and we would once again like to express our deepest condolences to his family and friends. Initiations are banned at Newcastle University and it is made clear to all clubs and societies that any such events constitute serious misconduct.  Since Ed’s death we have already made a number of changes to the way we raise awareness among our students about the risks of alcohol and how they keep themselves and their fellow students safe. However, having listened to the evidence we will be reflecting carefully on all that we have learnt at the inquest and looking at whether there are areas where we can improve what we do. Over the last four days we have been shocked to hear some of the details of what took place that night and do not condone this sort of behaviour in any way. Following our disciplinary investigations a number of students were found to be in breach of University rules and appropriate inidual sanctions were imposed. The Students’ Union also took action against the society involved. The welfare and safety of all our students are of paramount importance to us and together with the Students’ Union we work hard to help them stay safe during their time at university. On behalf of the University, I would once again like to express to Ed’s family and loved ones our deepest sorrow about the loss of a young man of such potential who surely had a bright future ahead of him.

title: pipe bomb suspect cesar sayoc
story: NewsPipe bomb suspect Cesar Sayoc once promised explosion worse than   as twisted past unearthedThe -year-old former stripper railed against Democrats like Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama, writing vitriolic posts onlineShareByNatalie EvansUS Editor Joseph Ax:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news world-news video suspect-charged-connection--mail-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailSuspected MAGA bomber Cesar Sayoc previously threatened to bomb an energy company after they tried to shut off his electricity. The -year-old, who is accused of sending pipe bombs to critics of President Donald Trump, warned the power company it would be worse than September th, according to a  police report. His extensive rap sheet also includes arrests for domestic violence, theft and fraud. Sayoc, a former stripper, showed flashes of violent anger and posted vitriolic screeds online. In recent months, Sayoc, a registered Republican, railed against Democrats like Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama on Facebook.  He also posted venomous broadsides against George Soros on Twitter, posting one tweet on Wednesday, two days after he allegedly mailed a bomb to the liberal philanthropists home. Hours after he was arrested in Plantation, Florida, on Friday, his social media posts and peripatetic work history began to offer the first sketch of a man whose rudimentary bombs launched a nationwide manhunt. Sayoc has been charged by the FBI after  explosives were sent to top Democrats including the Clintons and Obamas. He is accused of five federal crimes, the U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions confirmed tonight during a press conference. He faces up to  years in prisonfound guilty.  Sayocs white van, which was seized by authorities, had numerous pro-Trump stickers featuring the President and Vice President Mike Pence, as well as a CNN SUCKS sign. The van also had photos of Clinton and other Democrats with bullseyes superimposed on their faces.  David Cypkin, , a documentary filmmaker, recalled seeing the van parked outside a shopping center near his home for more than a year and as recently as this summer. It often had an open door or an open window, which led me believe there was somebody inside, Cypkin said in a phone interview. It stayed overnight. I saw it dozens of times.  Sayocs social media accounts are filled with anti-Democrat sentiments and racist diatribes. Two Twitter accounts that appear to belong to Sayoc are largely made up of retweeted posts condemning prominent Democrats, including Andrew Gillum, the Democratic candidate for Florida governor, and Soros. Two weeks ago, Sayoc threatened a former Democratic congressional spokeswoman on Twitter after her appearance on Fox News. The tweet warned her to hug your loved ones real close every time you leave home.  The woman, Rochelle Ritchie, reported him to Twitter, but the company found he had not violated any conduct rules. A Twitter spokeswoman declined to comment, citing an ongoing law enforcement investigation. A Facebook profile that appeared to belong to Sayoc featured videos and photos of him at multiple Trump rallies, including at least one in Florida. Several posts contained anti-Muslim statements.  Sayoc attended Bred College in North Carolina and the University of North Carolina in Charlotte and played soccer for both schools, though he did not graduate either one, according to school representatives. From  to , he worked as a male exotic dancer for Gold Productions Inc, according to a company employee. Sayoc left to pursue a professional wrestling career and later started his own company. He is a promoter, booking agent and live entertainment owner, according to his LinkedIn profile. He filed for bankruptcy in Miami in , according to court records. At the time, Sayoc said he lived with his mother and had recently left a store manager job that paid less than , a year. He listed a , tax refund and a  Chevy Tahoe vehicle as his only assets.  His LinkedIn page said he was pursuing veterinary medicine at High Point University in North Carolina, but a school spokesman said he did not attend the school. One of his Twitter accounts said he worked at the Seminole Hard Rock Hotel  Casino in Florida, but the Seminole Tribe of Florida, which owns the casino, said it could find no evidence to confirm that.  FBI director, Christopher Wray, announced that  explosive devices had been sent to iniduals. Sayocs fingerprints were found on a package sent to congresswoman Maxine Waters, Wray said. And he didnt rule out there being other packages. But he added: We do believe weve got the right guy. The FBI tweeted: The FBI can confirm we have one person in custody. There will be a press conference in Washington DC at the Department of Justice at :pm ET.  The explosive devices were sent to top Democrats, former senior US officials and prominent critics of President Donald Trump. Trump this afternoon praised the FBI for finding the suspect and compared it to a needle in a haystack job. He said: I am pleased to inform you that law enforcement has apprehended the suspect and taken him into custody. Its an incredible job by law enforcement. These terrorising acts are despicable and have no place in our country. And we will prosecute them, him, her, whoever it may be to the fullest extent of the law. He went on to say how Americans must uny and show the world they are united in peace and harmony. It comes as police found two suspicious packages earlier today addressed to US Senator Cory Booker and James Clapper, the former US director of national intelligence.  All the people targeted have often been maligned by right-wing critics. They included Democratic Party donor George Soros, former President Barack Obama, former Vice President Joe Biden, and former Secretary of State and presidential candidate Hillary Clinton. The Federal Bureau of Investigation has said that at least five of the packages bore aaddress from the Florida office of US Representative Debbie Wasserman Schultz, a former chair of the Democratic National Committee. There has been an outcry from Trumps critics, who claimed that his inflammatory rhetoric against Democrats and the press has created a climate for politically motivated violence.  After first calling for unity and civil discourse on Wednesday, Trump lashed out again Thursday at the hateful media. His supporters accused Democrats of unfairly suggesting the president was to blame for the bomb scare. Funny how lowly rated CNN, and others, can criticize me at will, even blaming me for the current spate of Bombs and ridiculously comparing this to September th and the Oklahoma City bombing, yet when I criticize them they go wild and scream, its just not Presidential! Trump said on Twitter.  Authorities believe the packages, which were intercepted before reaching their intended recipients, all went through the US Postal Service at some point, a source said. None detonated and no one has been hurt. The devices were thought to have been fashioned from bomb-making designs widely available on the internet, a federal law enforcement source told Reuters. Still, investigators are treating the devices as live explosives, not a hoax, said James ONeill, the New York City police commissioner. Investigators have declined to say whether the devices were built to be al. Bomb experts and security analysts say that based on their rudimentary construction it appeared they were more likely designed to sow fear rather than to kill.  The parcels each consisted of a manila envelope with a bubble-wrap interior containing potentially destructive devices, the FBI said. Each was affixed with a computer-printed address label and six US Forever postage stamps, the agency said. Two packages were sent both to Waters and Biden. Others who received the bombs were former Attorney General Eric Holder, former CIA director John Brennan, US Representative Maxine Waters of Calornia, and actor Robert De Niro. I thank God no ones been hurt, and I thank the brave and resourceful security and law enforcement people for protecting us, De Niro said in a statement. Theres something more powerful than bombs, and thats your vote. People MUST vote!

story: NewsWoman, , removes her belly button and gives it to boyfriend as presentWARNING - GRAPHIC IMAGES: Body modication fanatic Paulina Casillas Landeros underwent the painful surgery to dehumanise herself in a symbolic way - but she now regrets itShareCommentsByAliki KraterouLucy Clarke-Billings:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsPaulina said she knew she wanted to give the body part to Daniel as an ultimate token of love "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA -year-old woman removed her belly button and gave it to her ex-boyfriend as a present. Body modication fanatic Paulina Casillas Landeros, from Jalisco, Mexico, underwent numerous surgeries such as a back corset - which involves piercings on either side of the spine - and a split tongue. She later decided to remove her belly button as it is what makes us human before giving it as a present to her then boyfriend Daniel Ramirez, in . But following the removal three years ago, she says she ultimately regrets her decision describing it as reckless and impulsive.  The HR intern and tourism student said: I have always had problems with my family, I was not very close to them at the time. Body modications fascinated me, there is something very transcending about them. I was very angry, I wanted to cut all unions from everything and everyone. I wanted to dehumanise myself in a symbolic way, I wanted to do something controversial. I underwent an operation done by a professional but he gave me very bad advice on how to take care of the trauma so it got infected. I was suffering, I spent days in bed asI were quarantined, I couldn’t stretch, push, stand up or laugh. It gradually healed itself but not  per cent - it will never close entirely.  Paulina said she knew she wanted to give the body part to Daniel as an ultimate token of love. She said: I was very much in love with my then boyfriend, he supported me through many dficult times, and he is one of the most influential people in my le. It was something I did in the spur of the moment, we were young and stupid but that’s the way I felt. I put it in a small bag along with a note saying I love you, it was very emotional. He has kept it and he will keep it forever because he knows the meaning behind it. We are good friends now but we will always love each other.  Paulina says her relationship with her family has now improved. I do regret it when I put myself in my mum’s position, it must have been devastating for her, she was so sad, she said. I can’t imagine how it must feel, your own child wanting to break all their connection to you. If I could go back in time, I wouldn’t do it again, it was impulsive, reckless and I hurt a lot of people. Even though I did it for the wrong reasons, it has now taught me I should think things through before acting and it’s a nice reminder that characterises me.
